witnesses.name: Jean Jacque Stömmin
witnesses.occupation: sergent en la sergenterie de Hellingen

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over sheep purchase at Bitche - witness negotiating to buy sheep, George intervened saying if witness didn't keep bargain he should pay 4 pots de vin
testimony.threat_quote: Sy vous et vostre femme eussiez receu voz droicts, il y a long temps que ne seriez plus icy

testimony.quarrel_subject: Miraculous multiplication of cheese when servant disobeyed instruction not to leave spoon in pot
testimony.threat_quote: she should say nothing on her life

testimony.quarrel_subject: Called the son of her niece a bastard, Anne called him 'un schelm et un larron'

witnesses.name: Jean le Petit
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: married to niece of Girard George

timeline.subject: Anne femme Girard George
timeline.details: Additional depositions collected, followed by interrogation

timeline.subject: Anne femme Girard George
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture (ordinaire only)

timeline.subject: Anne femme Girard George
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - thumbscrews, strappado, rack, and brodequins applied but no confession obtained

timeline.subject: Anne femme Girard George
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders that she be renvoyée (released)

timeline.subject: Anne femme Girard George
timeline.details: Final sentence - after enduring torture she should be renvoyée

accomplices_named.name: Kühthans
accomplices_named.context: Executed witch who named Anne as accomplice 8 years before trial

accomplices_named.name: Margueritte la femme du porchier
accomplices_named.context: Released (renvoyée) before Anne's arrest; Anne returned after her release

prior_accusations.context: Named Anne as accomplice before execution 8 years prior

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Thiebauld
notable_quotes.french: Sy vous et vostre femme eussiez receu voz droicts, il y a long temps que ne seriez plus icy
notable_quotes.english: If you and your wife had received your rights, you would not have been here for a long time
notable_quotes.context: Threat made during quarrel over sheep purchase at Bitche

notable_quotes.speaker: Anne femme Girard George
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle se repentoit que lors que ladite Jeanne servoit aupres d'elle, et descouvrit le secret desdits frommages, quelle ne l'avoit jetté contre l'apparoye que la cervelle luy soit demeurée apres estant tant parlé
notable_quotes.english: that she regretted that when said Jeanne was in her service and discovered the secret of said cheeses, that she had not thrown her against the wall so that her brains remained there for having talked so much
notable_quotes.context: Said after confrontation with servant Jeanne about the cheese multiplication incident

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Jacques
notable_quotes.context: Anne's insult to her brother-in-law during quarrel

relationships.evidence_text: Anne femme Girard George de Hellingen
Said she was daughter of Pasquin Mulnier of Archingen
Married to niece of Girard George
she had been servant in their house
Had come with a relative, Adam Tailleur of Rimblingen

economic_context.details: Anne sold cheese professionally despite having only 4 cows - witnesses found this suspicious. The cheese multiplication incident raised questions about her prosperity. There were disputes over sheep purchases and wine payments at Bitche. Her attempts to flee were influenced by fear of losing property if she left. One witness thought a heavy sack contained money when they were packing to flee.

harms_catalog.harm_description: neck broken in stable, master who cut it up said it was bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute at Bitche over sheep purchase where George demanded 4 pots de vin; witness responded with threat

harms_catalog.harm_description: very ill for 10 weeks with unknown sickness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (identified by 'une pelerine de St Jacques' who healed him)

harms_catalog.harm_description: attacked, face scratched and blackened, dried blood from mouth
harms_catalog.attributed_to: unknown (she claimed great dog or three cats with blue candle)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: After witch Kühthans named her as accomplice

material_culture.context: Anne sold cheese professionally; miraculous multiplication of cheese in pot
Servant instructed not to leave spoon in cheese pot; Anne claimed iron, servant claimed wooden
Seen tied to fence outside curé's house; Anne told servant Jean Tisserand to mount it
Nicolas Thiebauld negotiating to buy sheep at Bitche inn
Penalty demanded in dispute - 4 pots de vin
Anne's husband and Nicolas Thiebauld delivering to Bitche
Supernatural creature that allegedly attacked Anne through window
Anne's alternative explanation for her injuries
Used to pack belongings when planning to flee, one very heavy possibly containing money
In stable, arrangements for selling it during flight planning
Healing object or person that cured Dietry le Roman and identified Anne as witch
Anne owned only 4 cows but sold much cheese

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, Anne's residence
Location of curé Jost Bayer; where black horse was seen
Where witch Kühthans was executed; location of inn and market; Chancellery location; where grains delivered for tithe
Anne's birthplace, home of her father Pasquin Mulnier
Home of Anne's relative Adam Tailleur
Home of Jean Tisserand who had been servant
Destination of Jean Tisserand when traveling with Anne
Home of Claudel le Suisse and Catherine; location where Dietry le Roman and Pasquin encountered Anne after baptism
Potential destination for Anne's planned flight
Where Nicolas Thiebauld's cow died with broken neck; where Anne's small ox was kept
Where Anne's husband was threshing before dawn when she was attacked
Where dispute over sheep purchase occurred
Where servant Jeanne went to fetch feed for animals
Location of Change de Nancy (appeals court)

economic_hardship_indicators: Fear of property confiscation if fled
Economic value of animals emphasized (cow worth 37 francs)
Professional cheese selling despite limited resources
religious_calendar_references: Christmas Day (when Anne's sister warned of arrest)
Baptism (when Anne and husband encountered Dietry le Roman)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Dietry le Roman accused her of being witch without her taking action; brother-in-law Nicolas Jacques called her witch without action; she complained about being called witch but never followed through
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: No legal action taken by accused despite multiple opportunities

legal_context.redress_outcome: She never took legal action despite being publicly called a witch multiple times
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Feared being imprisoned in cold weather and tortured

hearsay_chains.content: Story about black horse outside curé's house
Advice about crossing herself when making miraculous cheese
Identification of Anne as source of his bewitchment
That Anne and Girard were packing to flee

emotional_state_notes: Did not cry during imprisonment - she said this was because they wronged her
Furious with servant Jeanne about cheese incident
Frightened of imprisonment in cold weather and torture
Attempted to flee twice rather than face trial

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Disputed whether spoon was wooden (as Jeanne claimed) or iron (as Anne claimed)
Claimed there was another woman of same name in village who was greatly suspected as witch and now dead

third_parties.name: Kühthans
third_parties.context: Witch executed at Bitche 8 years earlier who named Anne as accomplice

third_parties.name: Margueritte la femme du porchier
third_parties.context: Released (renvoyée) before Anne returned from hiding; Anne's return after her release noted

third_parties.name: Adam Tailleur
third_parties.context: Accompanied Anne to speak to curé about accusation

third_parties.name: Jean Tisserand
third_parties.context: Had been servant for long time; told story about black horse

third_parties.name: Marie femme Nicolas Thiebauld
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: told by Jeanne about cheese incident
third_parties.context: Advised Jeanne to cross herself and make the cheese

third_parties.name: widow of sergent of Hallingen
third_parties.context: Dietry was in her service when he became ill

third_parties.name: sheep vendor at Bitche
third_parties.context: Selling sheep that led to quarrel

third_parties.name: Anne's sister
third_parties.context: Warned Anne on Christmas Day that she would be arrested next day

third_parties.name: niece of Girard George (wife of Jean le Petit)
son of Anne's niece
third_parties.context: Nicolas Jacques called him a bastard, leading to quarrel

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly significant case as Anne survived torture and was released. She maintained her innocence throughout, never confessing despite experiencing thumbscrews, strappado, rack, and brodequins. The document emphasizes her 'arrogance' and notes that interrogators wished they could have continued torture beyond the restrictions imposed by Change de Nancy. Key themes: long reputation (8 years), multiple attempts to flee, failure to seek legal redress for defamation, economic suspicion (cheese selling), cheese multiplication miracle, attempt to flee influenced by fear of torture and property loss. The trial shows the importance of the appeals court (Change de Nancy) in limiting torture and ordering release. Notable that Anne was named by an executed witch 8 years earlier but wasn't arrested until community pressure mounted. Her refusal to take legal action when called witch publicly was used against her as evidence of guilt.
